TopicTitle: The best way to setup a joystick?

Articles.Content:
I'm sure this has probably been asked a lot, but I can't find any recent thread discussing it.

I got myself a Thrustmaster T-Flight HOTAS X (http://www.amazon.ca/Thrustmaster-2960703-T-Flight-Hotas-Flight/dp/B001CXYMFS/) and I'm wondering if I should just plug and play, or if I should go to the Thrustmaster website and download their drivers first. I know KSP has some built-in support for joysticks, but is it enough to start using a stick with no additional drivers?

I actually bought that stick for when I finally get Elite Dangerous (or possibly Star Citizen) but in the mean time I'd love to try it a bit on KSP.

Edited May 10, 2015 by PTNLemay

I'm having the same problem. I am using AFBW and it works - kinda. My hat switches don't work properly . I can assign the button but the button does nothing when i use it. There are remote instances where it does work - but mostly doesn't. I'd really like the hat switches to work for EVA's and docking otherwise the whole thing is too clunky to use. The axis controls work but there is too much hysteresis in the mechanical action to be very useful for fine movement like docking. 
I really love this game but the controls are less than awesome. The devs really should do something for the controls on this game it would be the best space game by a long long stretch if the flight controls were tight.
